sentences: Tema käis kahel jalal kuni lõpuni.
Kaks meest olid kahel pool teineteist.
context: The Estonian word 'kahel' is the adessive case form of the number 'kaks' meaning 'two'. It indicates location on or with two entities, functioning similarly to English phrases like 'on two', 'with two', or 'at two'. This form is used when something exists or happens in relation to two people or things.
